text.p: The key June 10-year Japanese government bond futures contract will probably be stuck in range trade on Tuesday,traders said.
The upside of JGBs may be heavy, however, due to expected launches of about 145 billion yen worth of corporate straight bonds on Tuesday and Wednesday, they said.

NKK Corp, Ibiden Co Ltd, Hokushin Co Ltd and Tomen Corp are expected to launch a total of 45 billion yen in straight bonds on Tuesday, and unless the market falls sharply, Toshiba Corp is expected to launch 100 billion yen in straights on Wednesday, a trader at a city bank's securities unit said.
The coupon rate for the four-year government notes to be offered through a Finance Ministry auction on Tuesday, is likely to set at 1.7 or 1.8 percent, traders said.
MOF's offer is due at 10.30 a.m. (0130 GMT).

The four-year note offer is likely to be met with healthy investor demand, as the coupon rate is likely to be raised substantially from the previous four-year issue's 1.1 percent, the city bank trader said.
Another factor which may dampen JGB sentiment is the large open interest in June JGB futures put options with a strike price of 123.00, traders said.
"If the June falls to near 123.00, the speed of the fall may gain momentum due to moves related to the put options," a trader at a trust bank's securities unit said.
Open interest in the 123.00 June JGB futures put options was 12,564 contracts as of Monday's close.
The June JGB futures options will expire at the end of this week.
Hedge funds are probably behind the large open interest in the put options and may be holding about 6,000 contracts worth of the 123.00 June, the trader said.
